What is the official name of India accor: The official name of India according to Article 1 of the Constitution is "India, that is Bharat, shall be a Union of States.
Which Article guarantees equality before: Article 14 guarantees equality before the law and equal protection of the laws to all persons within the territory of India.
What is abolished by Article 17 of the C: Untouchability is abolished by Article 17 of the Constitution of India.
What are the key ideals mentioned in the: I don't have enough information to answer that question.
Under which Article can Parliament alter: Parliament can alter the boundaries, area, or name of an existing State under Article 3 of the Constitution of India.
According to Article 24, children below: No child below the age of fourteen years shall be employed to work in any factory or mine or engaged in any other hazardous employment.
What is the significance of Article 21 i: I don't have enough information to answer the question about the significance of Article 21 in the Indian Constitution.
Article 15 prohibits discrimination on c: The State can make special provisions for women and children, socially and educationally backward classes, Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes, and economically weaker sections of citizens under Article 15.
Which Article allows Parliament to regul: Article 11 allows Parliament to regulate the right of citizenship and override previous articles on citizenship (Articles 5 to 10).
What restrictions can the State impose o: The State can impose reasonable restrictions on the right to freedom of speech in the interests of the sovereignty and integrity of India, security of the State, friendly relations with foreign States, public order, decency, morality, contempt of court, defamation, or incitement to an offence.
If my car is stolen, what case will it b: It would be a criminal case under the Indian Penal Code, which addresses theft and related offenses.
If I am arrested without a warrant, is t: Arrest without a warrant is legal under certain conditions specified in the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973, such as when a person is caught committing a cognizable offense or when there is a reasonable suspicion of involvement in such an offense.
If someone denies me a job because of my: No, denying a job based on caste is not allowed. There is a constitutional guarantee of equality of opportunity in public employment, prohibiting discrimination on grounds of caste.
If the government takes my land for a pr: The government can take land for public projects under the right of eminent domain, but you may challenge the acquisition in court if it violates legal procedures or fails to provide fair compensation.
If my child is forced to work in a facto: No, it is illegal for a child below the age of fourteen years to be employed in a factory or engaged in hazardous employment under the Constitution of India.
If I am stopped from speaking at a prote: Yes, being stopped from speaking at a protest may violate your right to freedom of speech and expression, which is protected under the Indian Constitution, unless restricted by reasonable limitations such as public order or security concerns.
If a religious place stops me from enter: No, it is not constitutional. The Constitution of India prohibits discrimination based on gender, and religious places cannot deny access to women solely on the basis of their gender.
If I change my religion, can the governm: No, the government cannot stop you from changing your religion. The Constitution of India guarantees freedom of conscience and the right to freely profess, practice, and propagate religion, subject to public order, morality, and health.
If the police torture someone in custody: The right being violated is the right to protection from torture and inhuman or degrading treatment, which is part of the fundamental rights under the Constitution of India.
If I'm denied admission to a public univ: You can challenge the denial as the Constitution of India allows the State to make special provisions for socially and educationally backward classes, ensuring their advancement and access to educational institutions.
How does Newton define 'quantity of moti: Newton defines 'quantity of motion' as the measure arising from the velocity and quantity of matter conjointly. It is distinct from 'force' as force relates to the change in motion, while quantity of motion is the product of mass and velocity.
According to Newton, what are the three: I don't have enough information to provide a detailed description of Newton's three laws of motion and their application in celestial mechanics .
How does Newton derive Kepler's Second L: Newton derives Kepler's Second Law by showing that a planet sweeps out equal areas in equal times due to the conservation of angular momentum, which follows from his laws of motion and the gravitational force acting as a centripetal force.
How does Newton demonstrate that gravity: Newton demonstrates that gravity is inversely proportional to the square of the distance between two masses by showing that the gravitational force between two spheres is reciprocally as the square of the distance between their centers.
What is Newton's argument for why gravit: Newton argues that gravitational force acts on all masses universally because it is directly proportional to the quantity of matter and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between their centers, affecting all bodies, including planets and comets.
How does Newton explain the perturbation: Newton explains that the perturbation of planetary orbits due to other planets involves forces acting in different directions. These forces cause deviations in both longitude and latitude, affecting the orbit's plane and introducing errors proportional to the orbits' diameters.
What mathematical tools did Newton use i: Newton used the method of fluxions in Principia, which was a precursor to calculus. He didn't use standard calculus notation because it hadn't been developed yet; instead, he used geometric and algebraic methods.
How does Newton use the concept of centr: Newton explains orbital motion by describing centripetal force as the force that opposes the tendency of bodies to move in straight lines. This force draws bodies towards a center, keeping them in their orbits.
How does Newton handle motion in resisti: Newton addresses motion in resisting media by analyzing the pressure differences at the front and back of projectiles moving through fluids. He considers the resistance in both elastic and non-elastic fluids, noting that resistance is influenced by the density and nature of the medium.
In what way does Newton's notion of abso: Newton's notion of absolute space and time differs from relative motion in that absolute space and time are constant and unaffected by external factors, while relative motion is determined by the position and movement of bodies. This distinction supports his laws by providing a consistent framework for understanding motion and forces, independent of external references.
Who was the grandfather of Isaac Newton?: Robert Newton was the grandfather of Isaac Newton.
Do we know any other descent of Isaac Ne: No, beyond his grandfather Robert Newton, the descent of Sir Isaac Newton cannot be traced with certainty.
If an insured person takes treatment for: Expenses for treatment of arthritis at home would not be covered under domiciliary hospitalization, even if a doctor declares it medically required, as arthritis is specifically excluded from coverage for domiciliary hospitalization claims.
A claim was lodged for expenses on a pro: The cost of the prosthetic device implanted during surgery is payable. The lumbar sacral belt is payable for cases who have undergone surgery of the lumbar spine. The cost of the walker is not mentioned as payable.
An insured's child (a dependent above 18: The insured's child, being above 18, does not require pre-authorization for dental surgery claims. The claim process involves submitting the claim form, invoices, and medical reports to the insurer. Admissibility depends on policy terms and exclusions.
If an insured undergoes Intra Operative: The expenses for ICU care are covered up to the category/limit specified in the Policy Schedule or actual expenses incurred, whichever is less. The policy does not specify limits for Intra Operative Neuro Monitoring expenses.
A policyholder requests to add their new: The newly-adopted child may be added as an Insured Person during the policy period if the application is accepted, additional pro-rata premium is paid, and an endorsement is issued. The insurer may refuse cover if material information is not disclosed.
If a person is hospitalised for a day ca: For the day care cataract procedure, claims should be notified and supported with documents like a completed claim form, photo ID, age proof, health card, policy copy, medical certificates, test reports, and bills. For inpatient care at a non-network hospital, similar documentation is required, with claims settled on a reimbursement basis. Both claims must be submitted within the prescribed time limits.

If a policyholder files a claim for inpa: A prescription from a general practitioner and a discharge summary certified by a registered Clinical Psychologist are sufficient if the Clinical Psychologist meets the qualifications recognized by the Rehabilitation Council of India. The prescription must be from a valid Medical Practitioner.
A patient receives oral chemotherapy in: ECG electrodes are admissible, with up to 5 electrodes required for each case visiting OT or ICU, and at least one set every second day for longer ICU stays. Gloves are not mentioned as payable.
A hospitalized insured person develops a: Pre-hospitalisation expenses incurred 18 days before admission and post-hospitalisation expenses incurred 20 days after discharge can be claimed if they relate to the same illness and the in-patient hospitalisation claim is admissible.
If a dependent child turns 27 during the: Coverage for a dependent child who turns 27 during the policy period will end when they cease to be a dependent, unless specifically agreed otherwise for continuation until the end of the policy period.
A procedure was conducted in a hospital: Reimbursement for associated expenses will be in the same proportion as the admissible room rent rate to the actual room rent rate. The relevant clause is the Proportionate Clause, which applies when room rates exceed policy limits.
Describe the course of action if a claim: If a claim is partly rejected due to lack of documentation and the insured resubmits after 10 days, they can contest a final rejection by representing to the insurer for reconsideration within 15 days from the receipt of the claims decision.
An insured person is hospitalized for 22: Yes, the claim is eligible. The procedure falls under "Day Care Treatment," which covers surgeries or procedures requiring less than 24 hours of hospitalization due to technological advances, provided they are listed in the policy's day care procedures.
When the insured is hospitalized in a to: The hospital must have at least 10 in-patient beds in towns with less than 1 million population, while in metropolitan areas, it must have at least 15 in-patient beds. Other requirements remain the same across locations.
A group employer wishes to add a new emp: To add a new employee and their spouse mid-policy, the employer must apply for coverage, pay additional premium on a pro-rata basis, and receive an endorsement confirming their addition. The sibling can be covered if unmarried, unemployed, and dependent, up to age 26.
Summarize the coverage for robotic surge: The coverage for robotic surgery for cancer is subject to the limit specified in the Policy Schedule or Certificate of Insurance per policy period. Specific sub-limits for day care procedures versus inpatient hospitalization are not detailed in the provided context.
If an accident necessitates air ambulanc: Pre-authorization for air ambulance requires relevant medical details. If denied, treatment can proceed, and claims can be submitted for reimbursement. Mandatory documents include a completed claim form, ID, policy copy, medical certificates, and receipts.
Explain how the policy treats waiting pe: If the insured had prior continuous coverage under a different insurer and ported to this policy, the waiting period for knee replacement due to osteoarthritis would be reduced by the duration of prior coverage, as per IRDAI portability norms.
If a doctor prescribes an imported medic: The expense will be covered if the treatment is medically necessary, prescribed by a registered medical practitioner, and conforms to professional standards accepted in international medical practice or by the medical community in India.
A member of a non-employer group policy: If a member of a non-employer group policy dies during the policy period, their dependents may continue to be covered until the expiry of the policy period at the option of the insured.
For claims involving implanted devices (: For claims involving implanted devices, the requirement is to provide the original invoice with payment receipt and implant stickers. If only a generic invoice is provided without the implant sticker, the claim may be affected or delayed.
A spouse suffers a serious accident and: Home nursing charges qualify for reimbursement if they are incurred for the same condition for which the insured person's hospitalisation was required, and the inpatient hospitalisation claim is admissible. Required documentation includes a completed claim form, photo ID, age proof, health card, policy copy, KYC documents, and a medical practitioner's certificate regarding diagnosis and treatment.
In the case of a multi-policy scenario,: The primary insurer will seek details of other available policies and coordinate with other insurers to settle the balance amount as per policy conditions, provided the insured person submits a written request for the same.
Suppose the insured's hospitalization wa: Expenses related to hospitalization primarily for diagnostics and evaluation purposes are excluded, as are diagnostic expenses not related to the current diagnosis and treatment. Therefore, these expenses are not claimable.
How does the insurer treat requests to u: In the absence of a prior endorsement for nominee change, the insurer will pay the legal heirs or legal representatives of the policyholder, and their discharge will be treated as full and final discharge of liability under the policy.
List scenarios where prostheses or medic: Prostheses or medical appliances are not covered if they are not required intra-operatively for the illness or injury for which the insured person was hospitalized.
If a patient receives inpatient care for: Expenses will not be reimbursed because the AYUSH hospital must be registered with local authorities to qualify for reimbursement, regardless of having qualified practitioners.
An insured requests cashless facility fo: The hospital/provider must obtain a fresh authorization letter from the insurer or TPA for the changed diagnosis, treatment plan, or cost during hospitalization to maintain cashless eligibility.
If a claim for pre-hospitalization expen: Pre-hospitalization expenses claims are processed only after the main inpatient hospitalization claim decision is made. The claim assessment follows a sequence: application of proportionate clause, co-pay, and limits/sub-limits on medical expenses.

I have done an IVF for Rs 56,000. Is it: No, expenses for IVF (ZIFT, GIFT, ICSI) are not covered under the Arogya Sanjeevani Policy.
I did a cataract treatment of Rs 100,000: No, the policy covers cataract treatment up to 25% of the Sum Insured or Rs. 40,000 per eye, whichever is lower, per policy year. Therefore, only up to Rs. 40,000 will be covered.
Give me a list of documents to be upload: Duly completed claim form, photo identity proof of the patient, medical practitioner’s prescription advising admission, original bills with itemized break-up, payment receipts, discharge summary, diagnostic test reports, OT notes or surgeon's certificate, implant invoice, MLR/FIR if applicable, NEFT details and cancelled cheque, KYC of proposer for claims above Rs. 1 Lakh, legal heir/succession certificate if applicable.
